item.title: 2nd: ISZO
item.description: ISZO is a symmetrical queue. Take note of if mirroring the setup is beneficial, such as for some queue-based setups.

item.title: 2nd: LSZO
item.description: LSZO is one of the worst queues for 2nd PC. 3-piece setups are preferred in order to increase solve percentage.

item.title: 2nd: TISZ
item.description: Test TISZ is a symmetrical queue. Take note of if mirroring the setup is beneficial, such as for some queue-based setups.

item.title: 7th PC (Algebruh)
item.description: The following setups have been curated by Algebruh with the goal of minimizing the number of solutions for each case of 7th.

item.title: About and Acknowledgments
item.description: ABOUT H-DOCS Attempting to combine the modern look of FOUR with the scope and variety of HardDrop, our predecessors, with our own twist of functionality and accessibility.

item.title: Custom Minimals
item.description: header{max-width: 700px; left: 50%; transform: translateX(-50%); padding: 0 2em;} body{display: flex; justify-content: center;} .singlePage{width: -webkit-fill-available; max-width: 700px;} Custom Cover-Based Minimals A special method of generating minimals, where you can get minimal sets for maximizing a setup’s quad clear chance, T-Spin chance, etc.

item.title: Formatting
item.description: Generating Fumen Images Insert a fumen code into Rith’s custom <fumen> tags as you would in standard HTML. Images will be rendered in-site through JavaScript.

item.description: html{ display: flex; justify-content: center; width: 100vw; height: 100vh; } body{ width: 100vw; max-width: 1500px; } article{ padding: 0 1em; } #intro{ display: grid; grid-template-areas: 'text image'; grid-template-columns: 1fr 0.

item.title: Jigsaw
item.description: Jigsaw is a pair of two builds and their mirrors used as a high-scoring first PC or opener. It has a 100% build chance, considering mirrors, and the less efficient alternate build.

item.title: JSZ Queue-Based Setups
item.description: Notes This queue-base is particularly finicky with piece order. Practice: https://jstris.jezevec10.com/play/mode/2971 Setups IS ![[attachments_fumen/v115@9gQ4IeR4BeQ4Eeg0Q4BtR4Dei0BtQ4zhJeAgH.png]] ![[attachments_fumen/v115@9gA8Bti0wwilB8BtA8g0xwRpF8wwglRpJ8JeAgH.png]] SO ![[attachments_fumen/v115@9gQ4IeR4BeQ4Eeg0Q4BtR4RpBei0BtQ4RpLeAgH.png]] ![[attachments_fumen/v115@9gA8Btzhglh0B8BtA8ilg0wwH8xwH8g0wwJeAgH.png]] LO ![[attachments_fumen/v115@JhglBeRpBeg0BeglBtRpR4g0BehlBtR4h0JeAgH.png]] !

item.title: Mountainous Stacking 2
Parameter: Patterns
item.description: header{max-width: 700px; left: 50%; transform: translateX(-50%); padding: 0 2em;} body{display: flex; justify-content: center;} .singlePage{width: -webkit-fill-available; max-width: 700px;} The --patterns parameter for [[sfinder/|solution-finder]] is one of the harder parameters to understand.

item.title: Path-Filter Minimals
item.description: header{max-width: 700px; left: 50%; transform: translateX(-50%); padding: 0 2em;} body{display: flex; justify-content: center;} .singlePage{width: -webkit-fill-available; max-width: 700px;} Path-Filter Minimals The output from this may be bigger than the smallest possible set, but the difference can be marginal (one or two solves) as a trade-off for being able to find small solution sets quickly for setups whose strict minimals can’t be found within a reasonable timeframe.

item.title: PC Resources
item.description: Practice Resources Perfect Clear Setup Finder PC Gang's Setup Konbini, a collection of almost everything related to perfect clear setups.

item.title: Perfect Clear Opener
item.description: Shortened as PCO. An opener for getting a perfect clear. The build rate is 100% if an [[openers/perfect-clear-opener#alternative builds|alt built]] is considered.

item.title: S/Z DPC
item.description: Solution Finder Selected Setup v115@2gRpEewhBeRpEewhCeR4Bthlwhg0AeT4Btglwhi0R4?CeglJeAgH SELECT SETUP QUEUE 180/90 CHECKBOX COMPACT RESULTS DPC MINIMALS: SIX HUNDRED SCORING: ZERO EXTRA SOLUTIONS: FOURTEEN THOUSAND BUILD COVER: ZERO PERCENT v115@9gRpg0zhywRpg0B8Q4hlwwAtA8h0B8R4glBtF8Q4gl?

item.title: Solution Finder: Cover
item.description: header{max-width: 700px; left: 50%; transform: translateX(-50%); padding: 0 2em;} body{display: flex; justify-content: center;} .singlePage{width: -webkit-fill-available; max-width: 700px;} [[sfinder/|Solution Finder’s]] Cover command outputs the probability of setting up/building a specified field (or multiple), given a specified pattern.

item.title: Solution Finder: Path
item.description: header{max-width: 700px; left: 50%; transform: translateX(-50%); padding: 0 2em;} body{display: flex; justify-content: center;} .singlePage{width: -webkit-fill-available; max-width: 700px;} [[sfinder/|Solution Finder]]’s Path command outputs all the ways to get a perfect clear from a specified field, given a specified pattern.
